verses.verse: And he said to them, "Truly I say to you that there will be some standing here who will not taste of death until they have seen the Kingdom of God come in power."
Six days later Jesus took Peter, James, and John, and led them up into a high mountain just by themselves and completely changed in front of them.
His clothes started shining, exceedingly white like [sun shining on] snow, like no bleach on earth can whiten them.
There also appeared to them Elijah with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
Peter started talking and said to Jesus, "Master, it is good for us to be here; let us make three shelter tents, one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."
For he didn't know what to say, for they were very afraid.
Then there was a cloud that overshadowed them, and a voice came out of the cloud saying, "This is my beloved Son; listen to him."
And suddenly, looking around, they saw no one with them anymore except Jesus only.
As they came down the mountain, he strictly ordered them that they should tell no one what things they had seen, until the Son of Man was risen from the dead.
They kept those words with themselves, asking one another what rising from the dead meant.
They asked him saying, "Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?"
He answered and told them, "Elijah is truly coming first and restores all things. So why is it written about the Son of Man that he must suffer many things and be rejected as being worth nothing?
"But I say to you that Elijah has indeed come, and they have done to him whatever they wanted, just as it is written about him."
When he came to the disciples, he saw a large crowd around them, and the scribes questioning them.
Immediately when all the people saw him, they were surprised and running to him greeted him.
And he asked the scribes, "What were you questioning them about?"
Then one of the crowd answered and said, "Master, I have brought to you my son, who has a spirit that makes him unable to talk.
"And wherever he takes him, he convulses him, then he foams and gnashes with his teeth and totally wears out. I spoke to you disciples so they would throw him out, but they couldn't."
He answered him and said, "O faithless generation. How long will I be with you? How long will I put up with you? Bring him to me."
Then they brought him to [Jesus], and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground and rolled around foaming.
And [Jesus] asked his father, "How long ago is it since this happened to him?" And he said, "From infancy."
"And often it throws him into the fire or the water to destroy him, but only if you can do something, have compassion on us and help us."
Jesus said to him, "If you can believe; all is possible to him who believes."
Immediately the child's father cried out and said with tears, "Lord, I believe. Help my unbelief."

When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit saying to him, "You spirit who makes him unable to talk or hear, I command you, come out of him and never again enter him."
And [the spirit] screamed and convulsed [the child] severely, then came out of him. The child was like one who was dead; even many said, "He is dead."
But Jesus took him by the hand and helped him up. He got up.
When he came into the house, his disciples privately asked him, "Why couldn't we cast him out?"
And he said to them, "This kind can only come out by nothing except prayer and fasting."
They left there and passed through Galilee, and he didn't want any one to know about it.
For he taught his disciples and said to them, "The Son of Man is delivered into the hands of men, they will kill him, and after he is killed, he will rise the third day."
But they didn't understand this saying and were scared to ask him.
Then he came to Capernaum, and since he was in the house he asked them, "What was it that you were bickering among yourselves on the way?"
But they kept quiet, because on the way they had bickered among themselves who was the greatest.
Then he sat down and called the twelve and said to them, "If any man desires to be first, he will be last of all and servant of all."
Then he took a child and set him in the middle of them, and when he had picked him up in his arms, he said to them,
"Whosoever will receive a child like this in my name, receives me, and whosoever will receive me, doesn't receive me but him who sent me."
John answered him saying, "Master, we saw someone casting out devils in your name, but he doesn't follow us, so we prevented him, because he didn't follow us."
But Jesus said, "Do not forbid him, for there is no one who will do a miracle in my name who can speak evil of me.
"For the one who is not against us is for us.
"For whosoever will give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because you belong to Christ, truly I say to you, he will not lose his reward.
"Whosoever will offend one of [these] little ones who believe in me, it would be better for him that a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea.
"And if your hand offends you, cut it off; it is better for you to enter life maimed than to have two hands and go into hell, into the fire that never will be quenched.
"Where their worm never dies, and the fire is never quenched.
"And if your foot offends you, cut it off; it is better for you to enter life crippled than to have two feet and be thrown into hell, into the fire that never will be quenched.
"Where their worm never dies, and the fire is never quenched.
"And if your eye offends you, pull it out; it is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye, than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell fire.
"Where their worms never dies, and the fire never is quenched.
"For every one will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be salted with salt.
"Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, how can you season with it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace with one another."
